com.wm.app.b2b.server

Class DBTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wm.app.b2b.server.DBTypes

  • public class DBTypes
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains utility methods you can use to map SQL string-based data type names (e.g., VARCHAR) to standard, integer-based SQL type codes (e.g., 12). The standard SQL codes are based on the type definitions in java.sql.Types, which in turn are derived from X/Open.

    In general, a JDBC driver will automatically handle mapping non-standard data types to something that it (and thus this class) understands. For example, the ODBC bridge automatically converts references to the MS Access COUNTER data type to an INTEGER. However, you might want find the utility methods provided by this class useful for building administrative services or for debugging.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBTypes

        public DBTypes()

    • Method Detail

      • codeForName

        public static int codeForName(java.lang.String name)
        Converts a specified SQL type name into a type code.
        Parameters:
        name - A String specifying the name of the SQL data type (e.g. "VARCHAR") whose code you want to obtain. (Character case is irrelevant.)
        Returns:
        An int representing the numeric code for the specified data type. If the specified name is null or invalid, zero is returned.

      • nameForCode

        public static java.lang.String nameForCode(int code)
        Converts a specified SQL type code into a type name.
        Parameters:
        code - An int specifying the SQL type code (e.g. "12") whose name you want to obtain.
        Returns:
        A String containing the name of the SQL data type (e.g., VARCHAR) represented by the specified code. (The name is always returned in upper-case characters.)

      • nameList

        public static java.lang.String[] nameList()
        Lists all known JDBC SQL type names.
        Returns:
        A String [] containing all the known SQL types. All SQL types are included in the returned list, even if they are redundant (for example, "INTEGER" and "INT").

      • codeList

        public static int[] codeList()
        Lists all known JDBC SQL type codes.
        Returns:
        an int [] containing the known SQL type codes. The array will contain a value for every known JDBC SQL type, which means it may have duplicate values. For example, if SQL types "INTEGER" and "INT" are both defined, the array will contain two elements with the type code of 4.
